column4: well I am not versed enough to build debs .. IE I would not trust what I did .. and there are several apps on gnome-files that would be nice to try and or make life easier but there are no .debs .. so do we just suck it up and live without?
or build from source which means it wont play nice with apt
yea jdub I just did that with 2 programs .. got broken programs that didnt work at all .. like I said Im not a dev .. so basically if you guys dont feel like doing a build we dont get to use it?
wow .. guess its time to maybe start the distro hunt again .. that sucks
why don't you try *learning* to package those packages?
i guess debian/ubuntu has about the COOLEST people in place... they're faster at packaging than other (commercial) distros are
if I knew how I would
the ubuntu developers learnt it too
you try to talk to the developers of those projects to supply reasonable  /debian/ -directories
and if a project supplies you with a /debian/-directory in their tarball, you can try   "debuild"  to build packages
that would be great but all the stuff Ive tried so far didnt have that
then look at   apt-get source <something>   and try to talk to the developers - they'll be glad to have a debian/ubuntu tester for their project
just ask your question
you'll see if they pay attention
apt-cache search imake, apt-cache search xmkmf
look what i told you about imake and xmkmf
looking at debhelper isnt done in "just a minute"
try to calm done... packaging projects won't work being frustrated :-/
i can really understand trey`... try to take it slow
just add a new panel (somehow) and re-apply all the applets
nobody plays games
re-talking talk doesnt help you now, does it? i dont want to be rude, but try to get on a bit slower with people...
you didnt get a META-META-answer, so don't complain... most people are happy to get to know tools to help them
